alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Kearney; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 08 at 10:51PM CDT until August 08 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Phelps County in south central Nebraska... Kearney County in south central Nebraska... Buffalo County in south central Nebraska... Eastern Dawson County in south central Nebraska... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1050 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Miller to Elm Creek to 7 miles northeast of Smithfield, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Elm Creek around 1055 PM CDT. Odessa around 1100 PM CDT. Pleasanton and Amherst around 1105 PM CDT. Kearney and Riverdale around 1110 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Funk, Minden, Gibbon, Shelton, Axtell, Heartwell and Norman. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 236 and 292. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
